newsitem.title: USA: American Entertainment sues Bank Nationale.
newsitem.headline: American Entertainment sues Bank Nationale.

text.p: American Entertainment Group Inc said it launched a legal suit in Maryland seeking remedies after the company became the victim of "an elaborate fraud."

American Entertainment, a United States vintage movie licensor with cross-border offices, said it is seeking US$850 million in compensatory and punitive damages in a lawsuit filed against Banque Nationale de Paris of Montreal and The VIP Phone Club Inc of Baltimore.
The defendants could not be reached for comment.

The defendants are alleged to have committed fraud, conversion, breach of fiduciary duty and conspiracy, causing damage to American Entertainment's business undertakings, a news release issued by American Entertainment said.

American Entertainment said it took legal action after the company was forced into an Ontario receivership by the bank over a US$5 million revolving line of credit to a unit of American Entertainment.
The funds were intended to finance the accounts receivable of VIP, a telephone affinity club business, the news release said.
In December 1996, the bank notified American Entertainment of a default on the loan by VIP, American Entertainment said.
American Entertainment said it acknowledged the default, and agreed to fully cooperate with the bank in collecting on the outstanding loan balance, the news release said.
American Entertainment said it alleges that the bank acted both negligently and in concert with the other defendants regarding the loan arrangement, to the detriment of American Entertainment.
